_header: The wise man said to his sons
Note: All texts show some variation. Some of the couplets appearing separately in other MSS are listed individually: e.g., 42, 1867, 6442.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Trinity College R.2.59 (559), f. 209v: see 5530-3, f. 209v (below).

Bod9.First Lines:
[T]he wysman seyde to hys sonesThenk on þise prouerbis
                    þat after comes…
Bod9.Last Lines:
…We schal dye we noye how soneTo day a man to morow
                    none
Bod9.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             “Three Middle English Poems.” 
             Englische Studien
         23 (1897): 438-45: 442-4.
Schleich,  Gustav,
                        ed.  
             “Die sprichwörter Hendings und die Prouerbis of Wisdom.” 
             Anglia
         51 (1927): 220-77: 221-4.

BodRawPoe32.First Lines:
The wyse man sayd to his sonnesThynke on the prouerbis after
                    conys…
BodRawPoe32.Last Lines:
…God that syttyþe In TrynyteOn vs al haue mercy &
                    pyte
BodRawPoe32.Attributed Title: This ffolowyng ben the Prouerbis of wysdom (f. 54va)
BodRawPoe32.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “The Prouerbis of Wysdom.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         90 (1893): 241-68: 243-8.

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[T]He wyseman sayd vnto hys sonneThynke on these prouerbys that
                    sftyr comeWho that no vertew vsethHonoure in age hym
                    refuseth…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…We shall dy we wote nat howe sooneTo day a man to morow
                    noone
CamTCC599.Note:
Includes several couplets listed separately when in other MSS, including
                        4798; and see
                    cross-references.
CamTCC599.Facsimiles:
Fletcher,  Bradford Y. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Trinity R.3.19. A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, 1987. 

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.19.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.19.

Longleat29.First Lines:
Offe witte & wisedome þe begynnygeys drede of god &
                    þe endynge…
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…These prouerbes of Salomonþe wisest man þat euer
                    was one
Longleat29.Note: Copied into the lower margins; variant version: 64 lines.
